title-group.article-title: Convertible Debt Use and Corporate Governance

abstract.p: Convertible debt is a well-recognized mechanism for reducing the agency costs of debt. This study examines whether firms that attempt to control agency costs of equity through strong governance structures, including chief executive officer compensation alignment and board independence, are more likely to use an agency cost-reducing debt structure such as convertible debt. We find modest evidence of a complementary relationship between strong governance structures and use of convertible debt among a sample of relatively larger firms.
